title: Active Inference in Control Systems Engineering
description: Application of Active Inference to control systems design, optimization, and autonomous operation.
learning_objectives: Optimize system performance using expected free energy

content.overview: Active Inference provides a unifying framework for control systems engineering by treating control as inference and planning. This approach naturally handles uncertainty, enables adaptive behavior, and provides a principled way to design robust autonomous systems.

control_system_design.state_estimation: Inferring current system state from observations
control_system_design.uncertainty_handling: Quantify and manage model and measurement uncertainty

robust_control.adaptive_control: Online adaptation to changing system characteristics

autonomous_systems.self_supervision: Systems that monitor and adapt their own behavior
autonomous_systems.resource_optimization: Efficient use of energy and computational resources

examples.name: Industrial Process Control
examples.description: Chemical plant or manufacturing process optimization
examples.optimization: Minimize energy use while meeting production goals

interactive_exercises.scenario: Choose industrial process or autonomous vehicle
interactive_exercises.task: Define states, observations, controls, and objectives

interactive_exercises.description: Analyze robustness to uncertainty and disturbances

industry_applications.energy: Smart grid and renewable energy systems

future_directions.learning_control: Systems that learn optimal control policies
future_directions.standardization: Industry standards for Active Inference control

common_misconceptions.misconception: Active Inference control is less efficient than classical control
common_misconceptions.clarification: Can achieve similar or better performance with added robustness
Designed to work with uncertain and approximate models
